title: Homeric Hymns To Artemis 1
body: comment on the naming of the hymnic subject in this verse, in the context of the analysis of metabasis as a shift in subject within the same humnos

title: Homeric Hymns To Artemis 3-6
body: comment on the Ionization of Smyrna evident here, in the context of the analysis of the Ionian identity of Homer

title: Homeric Hymns To Artemis 7-9
body: analysis of metabasis as a device by which a humnos can make reference to its own hymnic consequent

title: Homeric Hymns To Artemis 7-9
body: making the metabasis explicit in the expression metabÄ“somai allon es humnon as in this verse, in the context of the analysis of metabasis

title: Homeric Hymns To Artemis 8
body: analysis of the god(dess) who is the recipient of the hymn honoring him/her as the object of the verb of singing (and comparison with Pindar Nemean 2)

title: Homeric Hymns To Artemis 9
body: analysis of references to shift to the performance proper as indicating that the Hymns are morphologically prooimia
